intro: Erythraea trichantha var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf erythraea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
